names.pinyin: tiao chong ren yang xue tang

actions: Nourishes Jing and Blood, fills the Marrow and nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin.
Strengthens Yang, nourishes Yin, astringes Jing and urine and benefits the marrow Tonifies the Kidneys and Liver
Tonifies the Spleen and augments Qi.
Tonifies the Spleen, nourishes Stomach Yin, tonifies Kidney Yin and astringes Jing.
Stabilizes the Kidneys, astringes Jing, clears Heart Heat and stops bleeding.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness, strengthens the Spleen, quiets the Heart, calms the Spirit and soothes the nerves.
With Gan Cao, for Spleen and Heart Deficiency causing facial edema, palpitations and shortness of breath.
Tonifies Liver and Kidney Yin, strengthens the sinews and bones, expels Wind-Dampness, nourishes the Blood and calms the womb.
Nourishes and tonifies Liver and Kidney Blood and Yin and benefits Jing.
With Shu Di Huang, for Liver and Kidney Deficiency.
Nourishes the Heart, calms the Spirit, moistens the Intestines, unblocks the bowels and astringes Yin Deficiency sweat.
Tonifies and augments the Heart and Spleen, nourishes the Blood and calms the Spirit.
Tonifies the Spleen and Stomach, augments Qi, nourishes the Blood and calms the Spirit.
Tonifies and Nourishes Ying, Yang Qi, Blood and Jing
Tonifies the Liver, Kidneys and Spleen

Urinary frequency with abundant, clear urine or
Maybe chronic diarrhea or "cock crow" diarrhea

modifications.purpose: Phase I to nourish the Blood and Supplement the Chong and Ren
Phase II to Invigorate the Blood, Tonify Qi, open the portals and promote maturation of the follicles
Phase III to regulate the Liver, nourish the Chong and Ren and resolve depression
Phase IV: add and subtract according to the patient's condition during menstruation.
